Package es.uma.ada.problem.statistical

Class MarkovModel

java.lang.Object
es.uma.ada.problem.statistical.MarkovModel
public class MarkovModel
extends java.lang.Object
A Markov model. The base structure is defined as a weighted directed graph (nodes are states, and arc weights are transition probabilities). In addition, the model includes the initial marginal probabilities for each state, and the probabilities of producing a certain output in each state.
Version:
1.0
Author:
ccottap

      public MarkovModel​(java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Reads a Markov model from a text file.
      Parameters:

      Throws:

  • Method Details

    • setSeed

      public static void setSeed​(long seed)
      Sets the seed of the RNG
      Parameters:
      seed - seed of the RNG

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Initializes all fields in the model

    • addState

      public boolean addState​(java.lang.String name, double prob)
      Adds a state to the Markov Chain. If a state of the same name already exists, no new state is added, but the marginal probability is updated. Any output probabilities and transitions are kept.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the state
      prob - marginal probability of the state
      Returns:
      true iff the state did not exist previously

    • addTransition

      public boolean addTransition​(java.lang.String fromState, java.lang.String toState, double prob)
      Adds a transition between two states (updates the probability if the connection already existed). If the states are not valid (they do not exist in the model, no change is made).
      Parameters:
      fromState - initial state
      toState - destination state
      prob - transition probability
      Returns:
      true iff the transition could be added

    • addOutput

      public boolean addOutput​(java.lang.String state, java.lang.String output, double prob)
      Adds an output to a certain state. If the state does not exist, nothing is added. If the state exists and the output has been previously added, the probability is updated.
      Parameters:
      state - name of the state
      output - name of the output
      prob - probability of the output
      Returns:
      true iff the state existed

    • getStates

      public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getStates()
      Returns a set with all the states of the Markov model
      Returns:
      a set with all the states of the Markov model

    • contains

      public boolean contains​(java.lang.String state)
      Returns true iff the state is in the Markov model
      Parameters:
      state - name of the state
      Returns:
      true iff the state is in the Markov model

    • getMarginalProbability

      public double getMarginalProbability​(java.lang.String state)
      Returns the marginal probability of a state. If the state does not exist, 0.0 is returned.
      Parameters:
      state - name of the state
      Returns:
      marginal probability of the state

    • getTransitionProbability

      public double getTransitionProbability​(java.lang.String fromState, java.lang.String toState)
      Returns the transition probability between two states. If either of those does not exist, 0.0 is returned
      Parameters:
      fromState - the initial state
      toState - the destination state
      Returns:
      the transition probability from fromState to toState

    • getAttainableStates

      public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAttainableStates​(java.lang.String state)
      Returns the states that are reachable from a certain state
      Parameters:
      state - name of the current state
      Returns:
      states that can be reached from the current state

    • getAttainableOutputs

      public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAttainableOutputs​(java.lang.String state)
      Returns the outputs that can be produced from a certain state
      Parameters:
      state - name of the current state
      Returns:
      the outputs that can be produced from a certain state

    • getOutputProbability

      public double getOutputProbability​(java.lang.String state, java.lang.String output)
      Returns the probability of a certain output in a certain state. If the state does not exist or the output has not been specified for that state, 0.0 is returned.
      Parameters:
      state - name of the state
      output - name of the output
      Returns:
      probability of the output in that state

    • simulate

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> simulate​(int numsteps)
      Simulates the Markov model for the number of steps indicated.
      Parameters:
      numsteps - number of steps of the simulation
      Returns:
      outputs at each step

    • logLikelihood

      public double logLikelihood​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> stateSequence)
      Returns the log-likelihood of a certain sequence of states
      Parameters:
      stateSequence - a sequence of states
      Returns:
      the log-likelihood of the sequence of states

    • logLikelihood

      public double logLikelihood​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> stateSequence, java.util.List<java.lang.String> outputSequence)
      Returns the log-likelihood of a certain sequence of states and observed outputs
      Parameters:
      stateSequence - a sequence of states
      outputSequence - a sequence of outputs
      Returns:
      the log-likelihood of the sequence of states

      Parameters:
